org.factcenter.qilin.primitives.concrete

Class Zpsafe

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.factcenter.qilin.primitives.concrete.Zpstar
      • org.factcenter.qilin.primitives.concrete.Zpsafe
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CyclicGroup<java.math.BigInteger>, Group<java.math.BigInteger>, Sampler<java.math.BigInteger>, ByteEncoder<java.math.BigInteger>, StreamEncoder<java.math.BigInteger>

    public class Zpsafe
extends Zpstar
implements CyclicGroup<java.math.BigInteger>
    The order q subgroup of the multiplicative group of integers mod p, where p=2q+1 and both p and q are prime.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Zpsafe(java.math.BigInteger p)
      Constructor.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean contains(java.math.BigInteger g)
      Check that an element is in the group.
      java.math.BigInteger denseDecode(byte[] input)
      Returns a random integer chosen uniformly from 0 to 2^{n-1} mod p (where n is the bit length of p's two's-complement representation); when p is large enough, this is statistically close to a uniform group member.
      java.math.BigInteger getGenerator()
      Return a generator for the group.
      java.math.BigInteger orderUpperBound()
      Get a bound on the order of the group.
      static java.math.BigInteger randomSafePrime(int bits, int certainty, java.util.Random rand)
      Return a random safe prime suitable for use with this class
      java.math.BigInteger randomWithSecretDLOG(java.util.Random rand)
      Get a random member of the group whose discrete log with respect to g is not known.
      java.math.BigInteger sample(java.util.Random rand)
      Sample an element from the distribution.

        Constructor.

        p - should be a safe prime (i.e., (p-1)/2 should also be prime).

        public java.math.BigInteger orderUpperBound()
        Description copied from interface: Group
        Get a bound on the order of the group. The actual order of the group MUST divide this bound (useful for choosing a random element of the group with a known discrete log)
